name: src/base.js
Base
description: Mux Base Class - Simple base class to be extended by all child modules.

properties.name: tokenId
properties.description: The ID for the access token.

properties.name: tokenSecret
properties.description: The secret for the access token.

properties.name: config
properties.description: The configuration for the Base object.

properties.name: requestOptions
properties.description: The HTTP request options for Mux Assets

name: src/data/data.js
Data
examples:
const muxClient = new Mux(accessToken, secret);
const { Data } = muxClient;

name: constructor
description: Data Constructor

params.name: accessToken
params.description: Mux API Access Token

params.name: secret
params.description: Mux API secret

name: src/data/resources/errors.js
Errors
description: Errors Class - Provides access to the Mux Data Errors API

name: list
description: Returns a list of playback errors

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: params
params.description: example { timeframe: ['7:days'], filters: ['operating_system:windows'] }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: src/data/resources/exports.js
Exports
description: Exports Class - Provides access to the Mux Data Exports API

name: list
description: Lists the available video view exports along with URLs to retrieve them

unknown.tagValue: Base
{Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: src/data/resources/filters.js
Filters
description: Filters Class - Provides access to the Mux Data Filters API

name: get
description: Lists the values for a filter along with a total count of related views

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: filterId
params.description: The filter name/id for see https://api-docs.mux.com/#filter-get-1 for a list of all filter ids

params.name: queryParams
params.description: example { timeframe: ['7:days'], filters: ['operating_system:windows'] }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: list
description: Lists all the filters broken out into basic and advanced

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: src/data/resources/incidents.js
Incidents
description: Incidents Class - Provides access to the Mux Data Incidents API

name: list
description: Returns a list of all open incidents

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: params
params.description: example { status: 'open', severity: 'warning' }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: get
description: Returns the details for a single incident

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: incidentId
params.description: The ID for the incident

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: related
description: Returns all the incidents that seem related to a specific incident

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: incidentId
params.description: The ID for the incident

params.name: params
params.description: example { measurement: 'median' }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: src/data/resources/metrics.js
Metrics
description: Metrics Class - Provides access to the Mux Data Metrics API

name: breakdown
description: List the breakdown values for a specific metric

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: metricId
params.description: The metric name/id for see https://api-docs.mux.com/#breakdown-get for a list of all metric ids

params.name: params
params.description:
example: {group_by: 'browser'}
NOTE: the group_by query parameter is required

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: comparison
description: List all of the values across every breakdown for a specific metric

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: params
params.description: example { value: 'safari', timeframe: '24:hours', dimension: 'cdn' }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: insights
description:
Returns a list of insights for a metric. These are the worst performing values across all
breakdowns sorted by how much they negatively impact a specific metric.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: metricId
params.description: The metric name/id for see https://api-docs.mux.com/#breakdown-get for a list of all metric ids

params.name: params
params.description: example { measurement: 'median', order_direction: 'desc' }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: overall
description:
Returns the overall value for a specific metric, as well as the total view count,
watch time, and the Mux Global metric value for the metric.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: metricId
params.description: The metric name/id for see https://api-docs.mux.com/#overall-get for a list of all metric ids

params.name: params
params.description: example { timeframe: ['7:days'], filters: ['operating_system:windows'] }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: timeseries
description: Returns timeseries data for a specific metric

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: metricId
params.description: The metric name/id for see https://api-docs.mux.com/#timeseries for a list of all metric ids

params.name: params
params.description: example { timeframe: ['7:days'], filters: ['operating_system:windows'] }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: src/data/resources/real_time.js
RealTime

name: dimensions
description: List of available real-time dimensions

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: metrics
description: List available real-time metrics

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: breakdown
description: Get breakdown information for a specific dimension and metric along with the number of concurrent viewers and negative impact score.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: metricId
params.description: The metric name/id for see https://api-docs.mux.com/#real-time-get-1 for a list of all metric ids

params.name: params
params.description: example { dimension: 'asn', timestamp: 1547853000, filters: ['operating_system:windows', 'country:US'] }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: histogramTimeseries
description: List histogram timeseries information for a specific metric

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: metricId
params.description: The metric name/id for see https://api-docs.mux.com/#real-time-get-1 for a list of all metric ids

params.name: params
params.description: example { filters: ['operating_system:windows', 'country:US'] }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: timeseries
description: List timeseries information for a specific metric along with the number of concurrent viewers.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: metricId
params.description: The metric name/id for see https://api-docs.mux.com/#real-time-get-1 for a list of all metric ids

params.name: params
params.description: example { filters: ['operating_system:windows', 'country:US'] }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: src/data/resources/video_views.js
VideoViews
description: VideoViews Class - Provides access to the Mux Data Video Views API

name: list
description:
Returns a list of video views for a property that occurred within the specified timeframe.
Results are ordered by view_end, according to what you provide for order_direction.

unknown.tagValue: Base
{Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: queryParams
params.description: example { viewer_id: 'ABCD1234', timeframe: ['7:days'], filters: ['operating_system:windows'] }

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: get
description: Returns the details for a single video view

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

params.name: videoViewId
params.description: The ID for the video view

return.description: Returns a resolved Promise with a response from the Mux API

name: src/mux.js
Mux
description: Mux Class - Provides access to the Mux Video and Mux Data API

properties.name: Mux.Video
properties.description: provides access to the Mux Video API

properties.name: Mux.Data
properties.description: provides access to the Mux Data API

properties.name: Mux.Webhooks
properties.description: provides access to verifying Webhooks signatures

name: constructor
description: Mux Constructor

params.name: accessToken
params.description: Mux API Access Token

params.name: secret
params.description: Mux API secret

params.name: options
params.description: Optional configuration object

params.name: options.baseUrl
params.description: Change the base URL for API requests.

name: src/utils/jwt.js
JWT
description: JWT - Signed URL token generation helpers
examples:
const Mux = require('@mux/mux-node');

const token = Mux.JWT.sign('some-playback-id', { keyId: 'your key id', keySecret: 'your key secret' })

name: sign
description: Creates a new token to be used with a signed playback ID

unknown.tagValue: {string} - Returns a token to be used with a signed URL.

params.name: playbackId
params.description: The Playback ID (of type 'signed') that you'd like to generate a token for.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options to use when creating the token

params.name: options.keyId
params.description: The signing key ID to use. If not specified, process.env.MUX_SIGNING_KEY is attempted

params.name: options.keySecret
params.description: The signing key secret. If not specified, process.env.MUX_PRIVATE_KEY is used.

params.name: options.type
params.description: Type of token this will be. Valid types are `video`, `thumbnail`, `gif`, or `storyboard`

params.name: options.expiration
params.description: Length of time for the token to be valid.

params.name: options.params
params.description: Any additional query params you'd use with a public url. For example, with a thumbnail this would be values such as `time`.

return.description: Returns a token to be used with a signed URL.

name: decode
description:
Decodes an existing token.

Note: This does not cryptographically verify the token signature, it simply decodes the values.

unknown.tagValue: {Object} - If the token could be decoded, it returns the decoded token object

params.name: token
params.description: The token you'd like to decode.

return.description: If the token could be decoded, it returns the decoded token object

name: src/webhooks/resources/verify_header.js
secureCompare
description: Secure compare, from https://github.com/freewil/scmp

name: src/webhooks/webhooks.js
Webhooks
description: Webhooks - Provides access to the Mux Webhooks signature verification

name: verifyHeader
description:
Verify a webhook signature. When enabled, Mux will send webhooks with a signature
in the http request header 'Mux-Signature'. You can use that signature to verify
that the webhook is indeed coming from Mux.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} - Returns true if the signature is verified.

params.name: body
params.description: The raw request body from Mux. This is stringified JSON.

params.name: signature
params.description: The signature that was in the request header.

params.name: secret
params.description: The webhook signing secret (get this from your dashboard).

return.description: Returns true if the signature is verified.

throws.description: throw error when a webhook signature verification fails.

name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "@mux/mux-node",
  "version": "3.1.0",
  "description": "Mux API wrapper",
  "keywords": [
    "mux",
    "video",
    "video encoding",
    "video transcoding",
    "api",
    "video analytics",
    "live streaming"
  ],
  "author": "Mux <help@mux.com> (https://mux.com/)",
  "main": "src/mux.js",
  "engines": {
    "node": ">=10"
  },
  "license": "MIT",
  "scripts": {
    "docs": "esdoc",
    "test": "yarn mocha --recursive ./test",
    "test:unit": "mocha --recursive ./test/unit",
    "test:int": "NOCK_BACK_MODE=record mocha --recursive ./test/integration --timeout 10000",
    "test:int:wild": "NOCK_BACK_MODE=wild mocha --recursive ./test/integration --timeout 10000",
    "format": "eslint src/** test/** types/** --no-error-on-unmatched-pattern",
    "lint": "yarn format"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "axios": "^0.18.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "jsonwebtoken": "^8.4.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin": "^3.0.1",
    "@typescript-eslint/parser": "^3.0.1",
    "chai": "^4.1.2",
    "esdoc": "^1.0.4",
    "esdoc-node": "^1.0.3",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint": "^7.1.0",
    "eslint-config-airbnb-base": "^12.1.0",
    "eslint-config-prettier": "^3.3.0",
    "eslint-plugin-chai-friendly": "^0.4.1",
    "eslint-plugin-import": "^2.9.0",
    "eslint-plugin-node": "^6.0.1",
    "eslint-plugin-prettier": "^3.0.0",
    "mocha": "^8.0.1",
    "moxios": "^0.4.0",
    "nock": "^12.0.3",
    "prettier": "^1.15.3",
    "sinon": "^4.5.0",
    "typescript": "^3.8.3"
  },
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+https://github.com/muxinc/mux-node-sdk.git"
  },
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/muxinc/mux-node-sdk/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/muxinc/mux-node-sdk#readme",
  "types": "types/mux.d.ts"
}

description: parseHeader with a known-hard coded header value

description: verify

description: with a malformatted header value

name: it233
description: will throw a timestamp outside the tolerance zone error

name: describe234
description: with a header value that is actually valid

name: it235
description: will return true when the payload is a string

name: it236
description: will return true when the payload is a buffer
